Grid

The grid provides a new responsive method for laying out sections of a page that provides more capabilities than the existing Bootstrap grid. It supports both horizontal and vertical organization of items, has independently-scrolling areas, and has automatically expanding items. It integrates with Bootstrapâ€™s existing .container class.

Boxes and Items

Boxes are the building blocks of a page layout. The .flex-box class establishes a flexible container that occupies the full width of its parent element.

Within it, the .flex-content class is applied to children elements to establish flexible behavior within the container.

<div class="flex-box">
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
</div>

Notice that the .flex-content class includes margins that behavior exactly the same way as the standard Bootstrap grid columns within a row.

Filling the Canvas

In most cases, you will want to start with a main grid layout that fills the entire height of the browser window. Add the .flex-grid-canvas class to your top-most .flex-box to achieve this.

View in new window 
<div class="flex-box flex-box-canvas">
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
</div>

Automatic Sizing

By default, the .flex-box class uses a horizontal layout for the children items, and the flex-content elements automatically expand equally to fill the available space. If the content within a .flex-content item requires more space than is provided through the equal distribution, the grid automatically adjusts proportions to accommodate this.

I need at least 400 pixels

<div class="flex-box">
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
  <div class="flex-content" style="min-width: 400px;"></div>
</div>

You can also specify that a child item should only be as large as is needed for its content. Specify .flex-shrink to apply this.

I'm shrunk to fit

<div class="flex-box">
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
  <div class="flex-content flex-shrink"></div>
</div>

Orientation

To change organize children items vertically, add .flex-box-vertical.

<div class="flex-box flex-box-vertical">
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
  <div class="flex-content"></div>
</div>
